definition: chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: It is every renju players right and free choice to make friends.
sentences.chinese: 每个棋手都有权力自由地选择结交棋友。

sentences.english: All chessplayers should have a hobby.
sentences.chinese: 所有棋手都应该有一项业余爱好。

sentences.english: Various pieces are set down in a designed order in the two ranks close to the player.
sentences.chinese: 不同的棋子按不同的顺序分两排摆在棋手面前。

sentences.english: The perception that people have of chess players and boxers is slightly warped at either end of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 人们对棋手和拳击手的看法都有失偏颇。

sentences.english: The chess-player conceded the game when he saw that his position was hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 棋手一看出自己陷入绝境，就承认那局棋输了。

sentences.english: Song Rong - hui is the early part of the last two years - and - coming female players.
sentences.chinese: 宋容慧初段是近两年崭露头角的女棋手。

sentences.english: I am inclined to think that I could reinforce my argument by appealing to the feelings of chess-players themselves.
sentences.chinese: 我想我可以通过求证于棋手们自己来加强我的论证。

sentences.english: Players will not be paired until all payments of their federation have been fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 直至所有费用交清以前，所有棋手不予进行编排。

sentences.english: The Singapore Weiqi Association provides different courses for various levels of Weiqi students in Singapore.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡围棋协会为对不同棋力的棋手提供围棋课程。

definition: Lee Chang-ho (1975-), South Korean Go player
opposing sides (in chess etc)/position (of opposing forces)
